result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan M Poblitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Victim/Use or Attempt Force [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.45(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*Pay DNA Surcharge 
*25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
*Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment, without the consent of the agent.

*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Lacey Firkus, unless requested and the agent approves 
*Comply with other assessments or services recommended by the agent 
*Complete Domestic Abuse Counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent 
*Follow any other conditions in previous cases
*Not eligible for early release
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and aftercare recommendations, if any - agent can use any assessments previously conducted if releases are signed.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk is Michelle.

Defendant Alan M. Poblitz in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Alan M. Poblitz in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:35 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification; victim appears in Court today and makes a brief statement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant agrees with Plea.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No Contest
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 2 and Count 4. Count 1 and Count 3 are Dismissed and Read-In.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

ADA Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court.
Court questions attorneys about sentencing.
Atty Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court and concurs with State.
Defendant makes statements regarding sentencing.

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - DRI

Count 2 - 
Impose 5 year prison sentence
2 years initial confinement to run concurrent with Count 4 and any other sentence defendant is serving
261 days credit 
3 years extended supervision to run concurrent with Count 4 and any other sentence defendant is serving
**Conditions of Extended supervision -
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Lacey Firkus, unless requested and the agent approves
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment without the consent of the agent.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations and aftercare recommendations, if any - agent can use any assessments previously conducted if releases are signed. 
Comply with other assessments or services recommended by the agent 
Complete Domestic Abuse Counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent. 
Follow any other conditions in previous cases.
Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs. 
Not eligible for early release.

Count 3 - DRI

Count 4 - 
Impose 4 year prison sentence
2 years initial confinement to run concurrent with Count 2 and any other sentence defendant is serving
2 years extended supervision to run concurrent with Count 2 and any other sentence defendant is serving
**Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Pay costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
**DNA surcharge is NOT being requested on this count
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 2

records.addlTxt: letter from Laice Firkus dated 05/11/16
Status conference on June 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Alan M. Poblitz in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Alan M. Poblitz in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
2:55 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received letters from the victim.  
Court informs the victim of ex parte communication and must provide a copy to the other parties. 

Atty Cousins makes arguments in support of the motion. 
Atty Wallace makes arguments in opposition of the motion. 
Atty Cousins makes additional arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Motion granted for the reasons stated on the record. 

Atty Wallace asks for a status conference as the parties are negotiating. 
Atty Cousins indicates the agreement was thru today, but will extend that to the status conference.  Asks the Court to conduct a colloquy on offers.  
Court questions parties. 
  Status conference scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 10:00 am.
